com.math.combinations

Class Combinations

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.math.combinations.Combinations

  • public class Combinations
extends Object
    Generates combinations of elements The order is always sorted in ascending order

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Combinations

        public Combinations(int n,
            int k)
        Constructor taking parameters for computing (n C K).

        (n C K) is always ready once the object is created using this constructor however the value if too large will always be erroneus

        Parameters:
        the - total number of values
        the - number of combinations

      • Combinations

        public Combinations()
        Default constructor takes no parameters. Note that set methods must be used before operating on the methods of this class
        See Also:
        com.math.combinations.Combinations#setN(), com.math.combinations.Combinations#setK()

    • Method Detail

      • nCk

        public static long nCk(int n,
       int k)
        This method computes ((n C K)) for the given parameters.

        If the value is too large for long a negative number is returned.

        Parameters:
        The - number of values that can be taken
        The - number of combinations required
        Returns:
        the value of (n C K); -1 is returned if the computation is too large to fit in long

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        This method indicates if the current combination has finished generating.

        A reset is required to start again else subsequent calls will always return the last combination.

        Returns:
        If the combination is still not complete

      • next

        public int[] next()
        This method returns the current combination and shifts to the next one,
        Returns:
        The current combination

      • update

        public void update()
        Computes the updated value of (n C K).

        This method should be used if (n C K) is required after calls to @see com.math.combinations.Combinations#setN() or @see com.math.combinations.Combinations#setK()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method resets the combination to its initial state {0,1,2,.....k-1}. After this method the combination can be generated again by calls to
        See Also:
        com.math.combinations.Combination#next()

      • setN

        public void setN(int n)
        This method sets the total number of values.

        Note: This does not update (n C K). That must be done if required by calling @see com.math.combinations.Combinations#update() Also, to prevent inaccurate states it is advised to call @see com.math.combinations.Combinations#reset() See also @see com.math.combinations.Combinations#getN()

        Parameters:
        The - total number of values

      • setK

        public void setK(int k)
        This method sets the total number of combinations.

        Note: This does not update (n C K). That must be done if required by calling @see com.math.combinations.Combinations#update()

        Caution: An update to k brings the combinations string back to start at 0,0,0....k with all previous progress lost.

        See also @see com.math.combinations.Combinations#getN()

        Parameters:
        The - total number of combinations

      • getnCk

        public long getnCk()
        This method is used to return the value of (n C K) for the current object.
        Returns:
        the value of (n C K) for the current object

      • getN

        public int getN()
        This method returns the total number of values that this object acts over. See also @see com.math.combinations.Combinations#setN()
        Returns:
        The value of n

      • getK

        public int getK()
        This method returns the total number of combinations that this object acts over. See also @see com.math.combinations.Combinations#setK()
        Returns:
        The value of k
